description:
And then there's the love that the fates toy with the history of one woman, three men and a whole load of sheep, Thomas Hardy's 1874 novel, Far From the Madding Crowd, which has been adapted for 21st century audiences in a new film. The woman at the centre of this Wessex puzzle is Bathsheba Everdene who inherits an estate from her aunt and sets to work sorting it out although her heart, well, that's not so simple.

Adapted by David Nicholls, this version is directed by Thomas Vinterberg. He's Danish, once part of Lars von Trier's Dogma movement. He wrote and directed Festen and more recently the Hunt. As with the 1967 version directed by John Schlesinger, much of the rusty business in chorus has been removed in favour of the central dilemma. What kind of man does a strong-minded woman of independent means really need? Unlike Schlesinger's film, Vinterberg's plays largely out in domestic interiors with glimpses of Wessex. But there again, another comparison with the 1967 adaptation, so I put it to Vinterberg that he had to negotiate that earlier film as much as the Hardy novel.

"To begin with, it was only about a script. I hadn't even read the book. I'm Danish. I'm from different culture. Hardy's something in Denmark, but not as big a thing. Then I read the book, felt deep in love, already fell in love with the script. I saw the first half hour of Schlesinger's movie and then redecided and stopped and I found it actually more right for me to just not see it, still haven't. So I think one of the advantages coming from Denmark is I wasn't burdened by this great heritage."

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Invisible
Invisible means something cannot be seen by the eye. What is invisible? How is it invisible? Why is it invisible?
This week's topic: The object became invisible... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) a magic trick making something invisible
2) invisible to the radar
3) what is important is invisible to the eyes
4) invisible ink
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

Since Shawn could not see the person, he listened attentively to judge the distance of the figure. In the meantime, he was curiously trying to figure out who it could be wandering in the building during such early hours. The next thing he knew was that a figure briefly brushed passed him, and continued down the stairs, also sliding pass Shawn's co-worker. There was no greeting, no "Hello" nor "Good morning." There was not even a wave nor a nod of acknowledgement. The person walked by as if Shawn and the co-worker were invisible.
